architectural_notes: Cover generation pipeline must correctly propagate and use the selected voice model ID; validate non-empty/valid ID before submitting jobs.
known_issues: Cover-generation jobs complete instantly and outputs contain no model singing/speaking, suggesting the selected voice model ID is missing/incorrect or not applied in backend generation request.

existing_features.title: Ensure the frontend correctly surfaces backend conversion failures related to missing/invalid model IDs by preserving and displaying backend error messages in the Create Cover flow.

new_feature_requests.summary: Fix cover-generation so selected voice models actually sing/speak in the output (ensure correct voice model ID is passed/used; jobs should not complete instantly with no vocals)

Update the backend conversion-job creation so the generated output audio is derived from the selected target voice model (so the resulting file contains audible singing/speaking from that model) instead of returning the original uploaded input audio unchanged.

Change backend job lifecycle behavior so newly created conversion jobs do not complete instantly: create jobs in a processing state first, then transition them to completed after a short asynchronous delay, so the frontend polling/processing UI reflects real job progression.

projectName: Fix cover-generation so selected voice models produce audible vocals and jobs do not instantly complete
